alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Warning issued October 08 at 6:45AM CDT until October 08 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 30. For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility less than 1/4 mile in dense fog and falling to less than 100 yards in spots. * WHERE...Lincoln County. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, until 9 AM CDT this morning. For the Dense Fog Advisory, until 10 AM CDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing. If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.
